metadata.title: CVE-2014-9626 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer underflow in the MP4_ReadBox_String function inmodules/demux/mp4/libmp4.c in VideoLAN VLC media player before 2.1.6 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a box size less than 7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc5 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
libvlccore7 - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-data - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-nox - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-jack - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-notify - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-pulse - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-sdl - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-svg - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.6-0ubuntu14.04.1').
